agenda.description: HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: State Affairs TIME & DATE: 10:30 AM or upon final adjourn./recess or bill referral if permission granted Monday, March 25, 2019 PLACE: JHR 140 CHAIR: Rep. Dade Phelan HB 400 Tinderholt | et al. Relating to the security of the electric grid. HB 669 King, Ken Relating to eligibility of certain local exchange companies for support from the universal service fund for the provision of broadband service. HB 1426 Guerra Relating to mobile Internet service access in an area subject to a declared state of disaster. HB 1446 Kuempel | et al. Relating to use of an electric cooperative's easements or property for broadband service. HB 1466 Murr Relating to repairs to be completed by telecommunications utility providers during a state declared disaster. HB 1960 Price | et al. Relating to the creation of the governor's broadband council. HB 2422 Anderson, Charles "Doc" Relating to the coordination of certain broadband projects by the Public Utility Commission of Texas. HB 2423 Anderson, Charles "Doc" Relating to the creation of the broadband office within the Public Utility Commission of Texas and the establishment of a broadband investment grant program. HB 2553 King, Phil | et al. Relating to regulation of mergers and consolidations of power generation companies. HB 2845 Canales Relating to the removal of wind power facilities. HB 2860 Raymond | et al. Relating to on-site distributed generation and energy storage resources. HB 2908 Patterson Relating to electricity pricing rules and operating procedures that eliminate or compensate for market distortion caused by certain federal tax credits. HB 3341 Davis, Yvonne Relating to requirements for adding a dwelling unit that has individual unit metering to an electric service plan; imposing a civil penalty. HB 3377 Hernandez Relating to a cybersecurity monitor for certain electric utilities. HB 3378 Hernandez Relating to an advisory body on the security of the electric grid. HB 3592 Zwiener Relating to qualifying projects for public-private partnerships. HB 3639 Murr Relating to establishing reporting requirements for telecommunications service providers regarding service interruptions. HB 3641 Murr Relating to billing for telephone service during service interruptions and establishing reporting requirements. HB 3643 Murr Relating to billing for telephone service during service interruptions. HB 3645 Parker Relating to the registration and regulation of brokers by the Public Utility Commission of Texas. HB 3867 Springer Relating to the authority of the Public Utility Commission of Texas to retain assistance for regional proceedings affecting certain electric utilities and consumers. ***ALL TESTIMONY WILL BE LIMITED TO 3 MINUTES*** NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
